page.title: 04ASHILL VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Amidst an atmosphere of{industrial {action}over teachers pay, a stubborn government attaching many conditions to their so called reasonable offer, and an increasing need for{teacher {accountability}from all sectors; life in our village school must continue. Teaching in buildings over 100 years old, coping with inadequate toilets that freeze during the winter and making do in{temporary classrooms, paints a poor picture. However 100 pupils aged 5 to 11 enjoy education offered by a{head and 3 assistant {teachers.}The quality of learning, the experience of life and the excellent relationships that develop far outweigh disadvantages created by education in a small, outdated rural school. Plans include remodelling of buildings and a new hall in the near future, hopefully 1986.
